summary.overall_findings: Drawing from 28 publicly available sources, Delta Air Lines' published materials address 6 of 7 evaluated responsible AI pillars. Transparency disclosures indicate the company reveals specific AI use cases in areas such as reservations, maintenance, crew scheduling, and customer service knowledge management. Furthermore, privacy policies state a commitment against using personal data for individualized pricing, relying on market dynamics instead, and an explicit "AI governance framework" is mentioned. Sources also describe AI as a decision-support tool for analysts, though concerns about individualized pricing and AI tracking related to fairness are highlighted. No qualifying public evidence was found for explainability.
